main_definition: Blackberry can refer to the fruit of a specific type of bramble, or it can also be used as an idiom in certain contexts.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A small, dark purple berry that grows on a thorny shrub
meanings_and_examples.example: She picked some fresh blackberries from the bush and made a delicious pie.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An idiomatic expression referring to someone who is slow or reluctant in reacting to information or events
meanings_and_examples.example: When I told him about the change of plans, he was like a blackberry - taking ages to understand and accept it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A nickname given to certain individuals due to their perceived slowness in reaction or processing information
meanings_and_examples.example: His name is Blackberry because his friends say that he always takes a long time to catch up with new trends.
